item.title: Report E-2023110337
item.description:
Report E-2023110337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 25-gallon release of Methyl Chloroform-343 (UN2831) from a 55-gallon metal drum. The product is regulated as a UN2831, 1,1,1 Trichloroethena, 6.1, III. Because of the toxic hazardous properties of the material, ERTS advised they would be sending a contractor to assist with this spill. One of the drums of the product was punctured by a forklift during unloading by the LSL terminal, causing the release to impact the trailer interior, pallet, and dock. The drum was tipped onto its side to prevent further spilling and absorbents were deployed onto the spilled area. The terminal uprighted the drum and deployed absorbents. Upon contractor arrival it was estimated 1Gal was released in a 4'x4' area. 1-85 gallon DM / contains overpacked drum, impacted absorbentsand 1-55 gallon DM / contains impacted absorbents, PPE were left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110324
item.description:
Report E-2023110324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: ST JAMES
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 AM a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Caustic Soda to a customer site (Mosaic) located in St. James, LA. The driver met with the customer site operator, completed the “In the Interest of Safety Form” (which is a form utilized by Basic Chemical truck drivers to ensure that enough space exists in a customer tank prior to unloading), hooked up offloading hoses, and began offloading. Near the end of offloading, the driver knew the tanker trailer was getting close to being empty, so he got with the customer site operator to check the level of the storage tank again to ensure there was enough room remaining in the product storage tank. The operator checked the level of the storage tank and confirmed with the driver that there was enough space to complete the offload. Not long after the customer site operator left the area the storage tank began to overflow and the Basic Chemicals truck driver immediately shut down the flow of product. The driver got with the customer site operator to notify him of the overflow and the operator stated that the tank level indicator had been malfunctioning lately. Customer site personnel were able to clean up the spill which was estimated to be approximately 20 gallons. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

item.title: Report X-2023110555
item.description:
Report X-2023110555

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: COVINGTON
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on trailer 98270 on it's side (orientation arrows not pointing up; proper hazmat loading techniques not utilized), box was wet displaying signs of a leakage and there was a smell of hazardous material. DescribePack: Some of the cans in the package were dented and one was leaking from a puncture/crack. All cans are soiled by the hazardous product leaking out of the damaged can. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Place package into a hazmat bin lined with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023110169
item.description:
Report X-2023110169

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was found in the unload area by management. Damaged was placed into a red hazardous tote; and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: While inspecting there was a small amount of liquid spilled on the top of the box and sides. While picking box up the bottom was completely damaged and wet. When placing damaging bottles into yellow drum there was a small amount of liquid that spilled ate through plastic and was smoking. There was no inner packing materials inside to keep bottles from damaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. After inspection damaged items were placed into a yellow drum for transport to next hub for disposal.
